reviewText: This fourth edition of the Banned! in America shockumentary film series contains graphic footage of death and violence and came out in the year of 1999, showing scenes of blood and gore. I have seen this entire movie, and it was good. Notable footage in this volume includes the Mendiola Massacre, which was an incident in Manila, the Philippines, on January 22, 1987, the Haitian General Election of 1987, which was a massacre in Port-Au-Prince, Haiti, on November 29, 1987, and the plane accident of Air France Flight 296, where three people were killed, and occurred in Mullhouse, France, on June 26, 1988.
Too gruesome I see why it was banned
Like DvD a lot thank you
it was boring and long and it wasn't what i expected. next time ill buy part one. thanks anyway man

I admit it, I'm sick, twisted and demented. I have no redeeming qualities....lol. That said, I've seen some of the footage before and I'm not sure why some of the material was included; I did enjoy the stuff that was new to me, probably because, as I said earlier, I suppose I'm easily entertained...lol. No matter, I did like this video although it's not my favorite..
